Class AllEmployees

  • java.lang.Object
    • AllEmployees
  • public class AllEmployees
extends java.lang.Object

    AllEmployees

    This class is used for storing and managing a list of Employees.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      AllEmployees()
      This is the constructor.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      int addEmployee​(Employee e)
      This function adds an Employee object to the list in alphabetical order.
      Employee[] getAll()
      Getter function for the array of Employees.
      Employee getEmployee​(java.lang.String name)
      Function to obtain the Employee object from a list by name.
      int getN()
      Getter function for n.
      void passTime​(int time, ErrorFrame ef)
      This function will be called when any of the time passage buttons from the TimeControlFrame is pressed and should, in turn, apply the passTime function to all the Employees in the list.
      void removeEmployee​(java.lang.String removeName)
      Function to remove an Employee from the list by name.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • AllEmployees

        public AllEmployees()
        This is the constructor. It assigns n (the number of Employees in the list) to 0.

    • Method Detail

      • getN

        public int getN()
        Getter function for n.
        Returns:
        int This returns the value of n.

      • getAll

        public Employee[] getAll()
        Getter function for the array of Employees.
        Returns:
        Employee[] This returns the stored list of Employees.

      • addEmployee

        public int addEmployee​(Employee e)
        This function adds an Employee object to the list in alphabetical order.
        Parameters:
        e - This is the Employee to be added.
        Returns:
        int This returns the index of the position on which the Employee was stored in the all[] array.

      • getEmployee

        public Employee getEmployee​(java.lang.String name)
        Function to obtain the Employee object from a list by name.
        Parameters:
        name - A String with the name of Employee that this method should look for.
        Returns:
        Employee The Employee with the given name.

      • removeEmployee

        public void removeEmployee​(java.lang.String removeName)
        Function to remove an Employee from the list by name.
        Parameters:
        removeName - A String with the name of the Employee to be removed.

      • passTime

        public void passTime​(int time,
                     ErrorFrame ef)
        This function will be called when any of the time passage buttons from the TimeControlFrame is pressed and should, in turn, apply the passTime function to all the Employees in the list.
        Parameters:
        time - This is used to get the amount of time that passes.
        ef - This is used further, in the Employee class, to warn to user when an Employee exceeds the maximum active time.
        See Also:
        TimeControlFrame, Employee
